title: Something offered to the consideration of all those who have had a hand in putting the late made Act, (entituled, An Act to prevent and suppress seditious conventicles) in execution For the sake of such who have any tenderness towards the innocent; and also for the information of all others, who have had, shall or may have, a hand in putting in execution the said Act, I shall offer something to shew, whom and what exercises of religion are concerned in and by the said Act, and what not, according to the most true natural genuine litteral sense and meaning thereof, and no other wise.
author: Gibson, Thomas, Quaker.
notes: Signed and dated at end: Written in the first month, 1665. By Thomas Gibson, prisoner in Newgate, ..
Reproduction of the original in the Friends House Library, London.
